name: DELIVERY FLIGHT - Flair Airlines (New Livery) 737-800 Arrival at Calgary Airport
description:
A big day for Flair Airlines today, as they took delivery of their first company-owned Boeing 737-800 Next Generation aircraft, in their new 2019 livery.

Calgary was fortunate enough to be the first Canadian city to get this bird, registered as C-FFLA, and was delivered here from Woensdrecht Air Base in the Netherlands via Keflavik.

Flair is headquartered in Edmonton, but, I believe, has leased hangar space in Calgary for maintenance.

This aircraft was a former Primera Air 737-800, and should be the first of several to be delivered as Flair phases out the 737-400s. From what I hear, the aircraft will spend a few days in Calgary getting post-delivery checks done before entering service.

Enjoy this video of the first aircraft in Flair's... unique new livery!

FLIGHT INFORMATION
Airline: Flair Airlines (FLE/F8)
Aircraft: Boeing 737-800 (B738)
Flight Number: F8913
Livery: New (2019)
Engines: 2x CFM56
Registration: C-FFLA
Route: Reykjavik-Keflavik (KEF) - Calgary (YYC) 
Callsign: FLAIR 913
Runway used: 17R
Date filmed: March 2019
